body: please include the relevant output error; it actually is supported, but hard to debug without more details

---------------------------------------------------------
Hi,
Thank you for replying. The following is the error I got. I believe the reason that I am getting this error is that `df_cam1_view[scorer_cam1][bp]["likelihood"].values[k]` needs to have the index for the individual before indexing the bodyparts, which means it should be `df_cam1_view[scorer_cam1][individual][bp]["likelihood"].values[k]`. FYI, 'head' is just one of the body parts I defined.


Hi @x35yao great, thanks for the report! We will look into it!
@x35yao, I'm looking at it! Just a side question: how many animals did you define in your multi-animal project?

Hi @jeylau, I defined 2 individuals and several unique objects. I walked around it by:1. List the unique objects in the 3D project config. 2. Include the unique objects into the bodyparts2plot variable. 3. When looping the bodyparts, drop a level for the variable df_cam1_view.
Thanks for the feedback! I ran into trouble earlier though, when running `deeplabcut.triangulate()` with data with 2 animals; it worked fine in your case?
Yes, I think you need to give the number of instances in each video.

Actually, it `deeplabcut.triangulate()` only works if I indicate there are 1 animal in the scene and stop working if there are 2 animals. I think it is because the variable `dataFrame_cam1_undistort` is defined different with `dataFrame_cam1`.

issue.title: Improved 3D data processing

repository.name: DeepLabCut
repository.description: Official implementation of DeepLabCut: Markerless pose estimation of user-defined features with deep learning for all animals incl. humans

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
PR allows for 3D pose plus tracking for maDLC. Updates:

- [x] vectorized point undistortion
- [x] seamlessly handle single- and multi-animal data
- [x] handle any # of view pairs (low-level API)
- [x] unit tests 
- [x] cross-view association (at the assembly or track level) for maDLC
- [x] accelerate and fix create_labeled_video_3d (see #1593)

Fixes #1593, #1624  

Demo (thanks to @jeylau and @intergalactic-mammoth; data from @MMathisLab):


https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28102185/162400692-b3e04fed-f054-4219-9d95-df5c1e41cd48.mp4

body: @x35yao, I just wanted to let you know that we've recently improved the 3D code in #1690. The issue you raised is already fixed, but we're missing one last item before merging the PR 😃

Hi Alexander,

Thank you for the feedback. I have a quick question to ask and I will really appreciate it if you can take 1 minute to help.

In your recent paper "Multi-animal pose estimation and tracking with DeepLabCut", in Figure 1a, you show a case where you have 2 different animals(mouse and pups) and each animal has a different number of body parts. I am wondering if you trained 2 separate networks(1 for each kind of animal) or just 1 network for all the animals. If you used only 1 network, how did you define the config file so that each animal could have a different number of body parts?

Thank you in advance.
Best regards,
Luke


Xueyang Yao
PhD candidate, Systems Design Engineering
University of Waterloo, Canada


________________________________
From: Alexander Mathis ***@***.***>
Sent: April 8, 2022 9:41 AM
To: DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut ***@***.***>
Cc: Xueyang Yao ***@***.***>; Mention ***@***.***>
Subject: Re: [DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut] plotting3D.py does not support Multimode (Issue #1593)


Closed #1593<https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/issues/1593> via #1690<https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/pull/1690>.

—
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub<https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/issues/1593#event-6396565138>, or unsubscribe<https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AK7BO5444DOORHMPKK7QOZDVEAZPFANCNFSM5IUBBXUQ>.
You are receiving this because you were mentioned.Message ID: ***@***.***>
Pups (with 5 body parts each) were defined as individuals with multianimalbodyparts, whereas the keypoints of the parent mouse were defined in "uniquebodyparts".

Thank you so much for the quick reply. If I understand it right, it only works in the case where only one kind of animal(pups in this case) has multiple instances so that other kinds of animals are treated as unique objects. If I want to treat other kinds of animals(parent mouse in this case) as individuals as well, I will need to train another network.
